definition: "knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to peel/to strip/to peel off/to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to swallow whole (idiom); fig. to apply uncritically

sentences.english: Girdling and other treatments can induce polypoid plants to flower earlier.
sentences.chinese: 用环剥树皮等方法可以诱导多倍体无性系提早开花。

sentences.english: The game-keeper began to skin the rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 猎场看守人开始剥兔皮。

sentences.english: He peeled an orange for her.
One day the swallow noticed that there were no more leaves to be picked.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，燕子发现金叶全都被剥完了。

sentences.english: Peel the skin from the onions .
Jerry got a bear that I skinned for him.
sentences.chinese: 杰利抓到一头熊，我为它剥了皮。

sentences.english: I was pealing onions when I heard the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 听到那个坏消息时我正在剥一个洋葱。

sentences.english: And claims, such as the availability of effective peelable grades, are difficult to substantiate.
sentences.chinese: 和索赔，如提供有效的可剥职系，是难以证实。

sentences.english: Every time he turns a page, he rips the page.
sentences.chinese: 他每翻一页，纸张便剥裂开来。

sentences.english: Banbo not be very kind to dust Zi, extremely Chan Yan and get its own integration.
sentences.chinese: 要极其斑剥而不类于尘滓，极其巉岩而自得其融和。

sentences.english: The little Klaus felt sad and removed the horse's skin.
sentences.chinese: 小克劳斯感到很伤心，把马的皮剥了下来。

sentences.english: Special sliding setting, stable running stroke, accurate stripping & cutting.
sentences.chinese: 独特式滑座，往复行程平稳，切剥精准。

sentences.english: Peelable lid for the European single-serve food market.
sentences.chinese: 可剥盖子的欧洲单一服务的食品市场。

sentences.english: He looks for scalps like an outcast .
sentences.chinese: 他象恶棍一样到处想剥头皮。

sentences.english: They strip it with their mandibles and pack it into the pollen baskets on their legs.
sentences.chinese: 它用上颚把蜂胶剥下来，把它放进它腿上的花粉篮里。

sentences.english: I'm going to skin that nigger alive, " he said quietly."
sentences.chinese: “我要去活剥那个黑鬼的皮，”他低声说。

definition: to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to pull apart/to pry open with the hands
to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out
to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
